snippet: In a concession, the American coffee chain said it would refrain from claiming certain deductions so that it pays some taxes regardless of whether it makes a profit.
abstract: Starbucks offers to pay about 10 million pounds ($16.05 million) a year in corporate taxes in Britain--10 million pounds more than it paid in 2011--in effort to defuse protests against its lack of contributions to public coffers at a time when ordinary taxpayers are feeling effects of government spending cuts.
lead_paragraph: In a concession, the American coffee chain said it would refrain from claiming certain deductions so that it pays some taxes regardless of whether it makes a profit.

headline.main: Starbucks Offers to Pay More British Tax Than Required
headline.print_headline: After Criticism, Starbucks Offers to Pay More in British Taxes
